result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas E Daleb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Previous signed order to extend probation contained incorrect extension date.  Subsequently, correspondence received from DOC advising that financial obligations are now paid, and request to extend is rescinded.  No further action needed.  cf

forwarded to Judge Dugan

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas E Daleb in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 60 days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served; Huber privileges for work.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months; probation may be transferred to Sheboygan County, if accepted.
Conditions:
*  Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge;
*  Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Defendant Thomas E Daleb in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Thomas E Daleb in court with attorney Mark Pecora for Christopher Lee Hartley.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape #16-020
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 21.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/1/16 @ 1:30p
